From: David Pane <dpane@...>
Subject: [archive-crawler] robots.txt problem
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=500983475; y=0u6Hundb9Ga3BGxR4Q5rkTM0d3aHhpXdpi7EWV0efpFsBfgPAgZeYA

I am running a crawl using heritrix.3.1.1 from the git repository with 
some minor changes that I do not believe is the cause of this problem.  
(I made changes in SurtPrefixedDecideRule.java to accommodate the 
checking of ip addresses as well as surts in my black list surt file. )

I had a webmaster complain that the crawler was not obeying his 
robots.txt file.  He reported that the crawler was requesting pages that 
should be dissallowed by directives for "*" user agent.

Here are some sample pages that it is requesting:
/wiki/index.php?title=They_Might_Be_Giants&action=edit
     Http Code: 200     Date: Dec 22 13:04:15     Http Version: HTTP/1.0 
     Size in Bytes: 54449
     Referer: http://tmbw.net/wiki/They_Might_Be_Giants

/wiki/index.php?title=Category:Sung_By_John_Flansburgh&action=edit
     Http Code: 200     Date: Dec 22 13:04:54     Http Version: HTTP/1.0 
     Size in Bytes: 21164
     Referer: http://tmbw.net/wiki/Category:Sung_By_John_Flansburgh

/wiki/index.php?title=Help_talk:Contents&action=edit
     Http Code: 200     Date: Dec 22 13:05:23     Http Version: HTTP/1.0 
     Size in Bytes: 22155
     Referer: http://tmbw.net/wiki/Help_talk:Contents

/wiki/index.php?title=1996&action=edit
     Http Code: 200     Date: Dec 22 13:05:48     Http Version: HTTP/1.0 
     Size in Bytes: 20813
     Referer: http://tmbw.net/wiki/1996

/wiki/index.php?title=Here_Comes_Science/Charts&action=render&chartOnly=Billboard%20Kids%20Albums
     Http Code: 200     Date: Dec 22 13:06:18     Http Version: HTTP/1.0 
     Size in Bytes: 1069
     Referer: http://tmbw.net/wiki/Here_Comes_Science

/wiki/index.php?title=Dial-A-Song&action=edit
     Http Code: 200     Date: Dec 22 13:06:46     Http Version: HTTP/1.0 
     Size in Bytes: 29906
     Referer: http://tmbw.net/wiki/Dial-A-Song


His robots.txt file is here: http://tmbw.net/robots.txt

I added his domain to my surt black list file while the crawler is 
running.  I am assuming that this update will be applied.  Please let me 
know if I am correct in this assumption.

Thanks,

David
